RileyStart: ^Oh hey! Alex said you might stob by. I'm Riley. Let me guess, you're a whiskey drinker.
RileyWhiskey: ^I can just picture you curled up by a fire reading Anna Kerenina, or something. Sounds pretty cozy to me. All you need is this to enhance your vibe.

hesitate: ^Oh, I'm so sorry. Complete stranger hands you a drink at a party, what was I thinking? < She reaches back and takes a sip of your drink >

g-0: ^Not me, but a friend of mine. I love being around people like this, but her experience reminds me that it can be really uncomfy for some folks.

Tolstoy: ^My granda would read me scenes from Anna Karenina when I was in high school. I tried reading it myself at summer camp one year, but oof, 900 pages?

c-0: ^I know it's cliche, but the scene at the train station at the very end. So tragic, and so gorgeous.
^But try the drink! Tell me what you think.

c-1: ^I do it when I have to, but I'd much prefer to listen. Audiobooks, podcasts, gossip. But try the drink! Tell me what you think.

RileyDrink: ^< The drink that passes your lips blossoms with the flavors of a crisp fall day. It is way too good to be served at this kind of party. >

c-0: ^Haha, not really, my granda just really loved whiskey, so he taught me to make all of his favorites. I wouldn't know where to start if I had to start with vodka or rum.
c-1: ^Tacit compliment much appreciated, but this is best enjoyed slowly. Plus, pro-tip, holding a cup at these kinds of parties gives you something to do with your hands.

RileyVodka: ^< adopting a Russian accent > A fine choice, comrade. After all, how will we keep our balls warm on these Siberian nights?

accent: ^< speaking normally > Oh wow, I'm so sorry, I don't know where that came from.

c-0: ^< Russian again > And to your health, comrade. Regretably, Comrade Levin has made of with the last of the vodka, and so I offer you this paltry substitute from the Western pigs.
c-1: ^Ha, I wish. You know, I think all college parties should have a designated bartender. I'm serious, like it should be mandated by the university.

c-0: ^Right? Acts of service are one of my love languages, so making people nice drinks is one way I can show them I care.
c-1: ^Not at all! A bartender makes people feel cared for. Feel heard. Also would make sure no one ever has to drink jungle juice.

RileyTastes: ^Yes, and it's such a fun game, especially when getting to know someone for the first time! It gets them curious, reals them in, and look, now we've started a conversation.

g-0: ^If I was wrong about the whiskey, let me try something else. Hmm... < she gives you a playful look up and down >
g-1: ^You moved around alot as a kid, you're into some niche craft like basketweaving, and you're going to love this drink I made just for you.

s0: ^ < Riley gives you a friendly pat on the shoulder, but quickly turns to offer another one of her drinks to an aquaintance. >
s1: ^ < Riley winks and ruefully holds up her empty ice bucket as she walks away.>
